{"step_by_step_thinking": "L-asparaginase is an enzyme that breaks down the amino acid asparagine. It is used in the treatment of certain types of leukemia. AML (Acute Myeloid Leukemia), CML (Chronic Myeloid Leukemia), and CLL (Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia) are not typically treated with L-asparaginase. However, ALL (Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia) is commonly treated with L-asparaginase as it deprives the leukemia cells of asparagine, which they require for growth and survival.", "answer_choice": "B"}
